attributes.action: Alter schools dress codes so kids can express themselves within reason.
attributes.additional_details: Lots of students in schools want to wear rings, bracelets, or badges, or dye their hair fun colours, but schools rules don't allow them to as apparently it affects their learning, when actually NOT being able to express yourself seriously effects your learning and mental health in the future.
attributes.background: Schools dress codes in school need to be altered slightly so students can express themselves more and be themselves around their friends. It is scientifically proven that lack of expression as a child can seriously affect your life in the future.

rejection.details:
While schools are required to set uniform policies, the content of those policies is a matter for individual schools not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You might like to sign these petitions which call for similar actions:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608259
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607158
